screen.title: Multi-project bugs
screen.summary: Launchpad's bug tracker is unique. It helps you track the status of the same bug as it affects multiple projects and to work with those projects to find a solution.
screen.callout: Launchpad knows about four occurrences of this bug and tracks its status in each community. Those communities that use Launchpad's bug tracker share this single bug report, with a common comment history and bug number.
Launchpad's openoffice.org (Ubuntu) community use Launchpad's bug tracker directly. They have assigned Matthias Klose to take responsibility for solving the bug as it affects them.

The upstream OpenOffice.org community and Debian's neon26 team use external bug trackers. Launchpad tracks the status of the bug in their trackers but also links to their bug reports, making it easy to follow the detail of their progress.
If you discover another community affected by this bug, it's easy to include them in the conversation.

screen.title: Discussing bugs
screen.summary: Anyone who is interested can participate in the discussion of a bug. Launchpad's bug tracker offers both web and email interfaces, making it ideal for both newer users and experienced developers.
screen.callout: You can attach files - such as screen shots and logs - to help bug triagers understand the cause of a bug.

Subscribing to a bug lets you follow its progress by email. Launchpad users and teams can choose to subscribe to a bug, while a project's bug contact is automatically notified of new bug reports and changes to existing bugs.
screen.transition: In some projects, bug reports are used to request new features. Let's look at Launchpad's Blueprint Tracker, which helps you track and develop ideas for your software.
